annotation.spannedText: This practice blunted the obvious reactions (fever and rash) to the live virus in the vaccine, but had serious potential consequences

annotation.spannedText: the rash is caused by a cell mitigated immune reaction, which destroys the cells infected with the measles virus

annotation.spannedText: Before the era of vaccination, natural measles would mostly occur in younger children. But with the advent of vaccination there was an upward shift in age of infection to adolescents

annotation.spannedText: unlike natural measles infection, the measles vaccine does not appear to provide such long lasting protection

annotation.spannedText: The solid, lifelong protection afforded by natural infection has been replaced with a vaccine-induced immunity that wanes with time

annotation.spannedText: Waning immunity among the vaccinated, combined with lower natural disease boosting will create substantial numbers of measles-susceptible people in highly vaccinated populations
